Name: Larry Venzant
Description:
Larry was stabbed repeatedly and castrated by David Feikema after Feikema discovered that she was trans.

> Feikema met transvestite Larry Venzant on December 19, 1993 and took him home to have sex. Feikema claims he believed that Venzant was a biological woman. According to Feikema, after a disagreement over what type of sex they would have, a fight ensued, leading to the fatal stabbing of Venzant. Upon learning that he was a man, Feikema cut off Venzant’s penis and put it into the victim’s mouth. Feikema was convicted of first degree murder, but mentally ill, and sentenced for 21-years at a correctional center where he would also receive psychiatric therapy. Feikema was paroled on March 24, 2004.
> 
> In the course of an interview Feikema says that by cutting off his penis "I was giving Venzant what what he wanted, that is, being a woman "(Dong, 1997) and emphasizes that the opinion of his madness at the time of the crime was not unanimous. Most of his interlocutors, he says, upon hearing the details of his case, usually tell him that he "did the right thing", whatever anyone in his situation would have done.

Although we don't know Larry's true name, we can at least acknowledge her trans identity.

Name: Alana Kela
Description:
Alana was found on her front porch, in her nightgown and robe. She had been shot.

The date of her murder is not known, other than that it was sometime in 1993.

> Alana Kela was a well loved entertainer out of the United States.  She was active in the 1980’s and 1990’s.  Alana was sadly murdered in 1993.  Those who got know her have many beautiful memories to hold on to and cherish.

Name: Brandon Teena
Source ref: tdor.info/12-31-1993/Brandon (aka Brandon Teena, Tenna Ray Brandon, Teena Brandon)
Description:
Brandon was raped and murdered by people he thought were his friends after they discovered that he was a trans man.

> John Lotter and Tom Nissen forced Teena to leave a Christmas party and drove him to a remote area in Humboldt, where they brutally gang-raped him.
>  
> A week later, on December 31, 1993, Lotter and Nissen shot and killed Teena at point-blank range and then stabbed him, after learning that he had reported the incident to the police. The duo also murdered the other two adults in the household, Lisa Lambert and Phillip DeVine, all in front of Lambert’s eight-month-old son.
>  
> Nissen and Lotter were arrested and charged the same day. Both were found guilty of murder. Nissen received life in prison in exchange for his testimony against Lotter, and Lotter received the death penalty. (In 2015, Nebraska abolished the death penalty, thus giving Lotter a life sentence.)
> 
> The story is the subject of the Academy Award-winning 1999 film Boys Don’t Cry (starring Hilary Swank), and has brought wide attention to hate crimes against the trans community.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/uxWt9rxNzjg" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Teena's murder, along with that of Matthew Shepard, led to increased lobbying for hate crime laws in the United States.
